In the modern day Twokinds setting, being "in the fur" is less practiced, but still technically legal. It's actual a big point of contention in the setting, as many humans wish for it to be made illegal, ever since the two races began cohabitating more.

Some humans argue against it on moral grounds, because they don't want kids exposed to that kind of thing. But others argue it's an equality issue. Since humans can't, they claim it's unequal treatment under the law, which is against their rights.
So it's one of the big conflicts of the modern setting.
The Keidran see it as yet another attempt by humans to destroy their culture for the sake of human sensibilities.

Yeah, they're dancing lights, just magic decoration.
That said, they are based on actual living Wisps or Dancing Lights.
Not to be confused with Will o the Wisps, just plane wisps are mostly harmless things that float around. They're like jellyfish.
They gather around strong emotion and absorb it. If one passes through someone, though, they'll get all the emotion it was storing up, which can be bad or dangerous.
It's why fake dancing lights became a thing, because the living wisps often gathered during parties.
I don't see why they wouldn't be.
They're just made of harmless magic
Some people keep them as pets in jars.
The negative ones feed off things like fear or anger.
So they'll take away some of your fear or anger. You wouldn't want a happy one.
You don't want it to eat your happiness.
They're not related to pixies at all
These are just magic balls of light and emotion.
Well, not the ones in this picture, they're just fakes.
